reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Kazakhstan - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Researcher Links Workshop Call June

description.narrative: Joint workshops on priority research areas, with a focus on building capacity of early career researchers

To build sustainable research links between the UK and partner countries and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are relevant to economic development and social welfare. 10 workshops per year each with between 15 and 20 researchers from the UK and 20 from Kazakhstan

title.narrative: Institutional Links Call October

description.narrative: Grants for research and innovation collaborations between the UK and partner countries to support the translation of research into benefit

To initiate new research and innovation collaborations between academic groups, departments and institutions in partner countries and the UK and support the exchange of research and innovation expertise and the translation of research knowledge into tangible benefits. Target: 6 Institutional Links grants awarded in 2015

title.narrative: Researcher Links Post-Doctoral Mobility Grants

description.narrative: Post-doc grants for Kazakhstan researchers to come to the UK

The aim of the Researcher Links Post-Doctoral Mobility Scheme is to enhance and strengthen links between the UK and Kazakhstan for future collaboration, build research capacity in Kazakhstan and enhance researchers’ career opportunities. Between 3 and 10 Post-Doctoral Mobility grants per year

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: PhD Support Service

description.narrative: Tailored support for Kazakhstani PhD students to find a supervisor and university in the UK, run on the British Council's behalf by the UK Higher Education International Unit

The aim of the PhD Placement service is to strengthen the pipeline of Kazakhstani Researchers entering a Research career by collaborating with the Centre for International Programmes (who administer the Bolashak Presidential Scholarship Programme) to help Kazakhstani PhD students find academic supervisors and navigate the application system at UK universities. Succesful students will be funded by the Bolashak Presidential Scholarship Programme. We aim to place 10 students per year.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional Development Centres (Including Researcher Connect)

description.narrative: Centres offering professional development courses for researchers in Kazakhstan

The aims of the Professional Development Centres programme are to: - Support skills development in researchers, research managers, and support staff, to give them the knowledge and skills they need to better access funding, communicate their research, translate their research into benefit and work strategically and internationally. - Support dialogue and knowledge exchange on research governance and strategic research policy development to ensure that the research environment in partner countries is more conducive to achieving maximum impact from high quality research. Target: Deliver 25 days of training per year in six centres across Kazakhstan

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering Education

description.narrative: Piloting a Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering innovation projects competition for Kazakhstani high school students and undergraduates

The main aims of the Science, Technology, Mathematics and Engineering (STEM) competition are to: • Encourage more Kazakhstani schoolchildren and undergraduate students to gain relevant skills and knowledge and pursue a STEM-related career, thus building absorptive capacity for research and innovation in Kazakhstan • Support the uptake of STEM education opportunities by traditionally under-represented groups • Equip Kazakhstani schoolchildren and undergraduate students with a better understanding and appreciate of STEM education in an international context. • Support dialogue and knowledge exchange between the UK and Kazakhstan around innovative approaches to STEM education
